context.description: Data Adapters
Hello here is our help for jasperserver
Here you can select a template for the new report, to define its base layout. Select the template by clicking on it, then hit the button "Next" to proceed.

topic.label: Designing a report with JasperSoft Studio

context.description: Here you can select the folder in the workspace where you want to put the report, and name for the report itself, then hit the button "Next" to proceed.

topic.label: Designing a report with JasperSoft Studio

context.description: Here you can define a datasource, the location from which the data is taken to fill the report. A datasource is composed by a data adapter, that is a connection to a resource (like and XML file or an SQL database), and eventually a query to identify fields that will be extracted from the resource.

topic.label: Designing a report with JasperSoft Studio

context.description: Here you can select which fields, discovered in the data adapter, will be added to the report or table. Fields that are not added now can be added later.

topic.label: Designing a report with JasperSoft Studio

context.description: Here you can choose which from the added fields will became groups

topic.label: Designing a report with JasperSoft Studio

context.title: Font management
context.description: Font Management

context.title: Select a dataset
context.description: Here you need to specify a dataset, choosing if you want to create a new one or reuse another one created before.

context.title: Select name and type
context.description: Here you need to specify a name for the new dataset, and it must be unique since it is used as identifier. You also need to specify if the new dataset get the data from a data source (like a database or a XML file for example) or if it is empty and has no data in it

context.title: Select the connection
context.description: Here you need to specify the connection used from the dataset to retrive the data from the datasource. You can use an existing connection created for another datasource, or create a new one, choose the connection with an expression, or create and empty connection (this case it is equivalent to have an empty dataset

context.title: Select the layout
context.description: Here you can select which columns will be created for the table. Note that all the fields selected in the previous steps will be inserted into the Detail cell, so it is not present in this selection

context.title: Select the chart type
context.description: Here you can select the type of chart you want to place into the report, select a template and hit Next.

context.title: Select the chart data
context.description: Here you can configure your chart. The dataset define the context of the report, or in other words the location of the data used to fill the chart. Reset type allow you to periodically reset the dataset. The increment when expressions allows you to add a flag to determine whether to add a record to the record set designed to feed the chart. You can provide one or more series using fields and variables
